p: The external dependency on food products has been a recurring issue in all discussions. In fact, the level of food self-sufficiency in the Islands is considered low and decreasing ( Godenau and Nuez-Yáñez, 2013). The participants exposed concern on the low chance of meeting their basic goods needs in the face of possible external shocks (peak prices, etc.): « imagine there is an international conflict. We depend exclusively on what comes from abroad by sea and air. There are economic studies indicating that we would have provisions for 3 days, on the fourth day we would kill each other if there was no external supply» (FG held in La Orotava; see Hernandez et al., 2017).
